definition: to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: Smith's new store opened last week and it's going great guns.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯上周新开的店业绩扶摇直上。

sentences.english: Bird is like clouds hang down the wings, although nine miles can also soared.
sentences.chinese: 巨鸟有如垂天之云般的翅膀，虽九万里亦可扶摇直上。

sentences.english: Mirs day with the wind, the ninety thousand rise directly to a high position.
sentences.chinese: 大鹏一日同风起，扶摇直上九万里。

sentences.english: You are seeing cinders dancing in the updraft.
sentences.chinese: 你还看到漫天飞舞的火灰在扶摇直上。

sentences.english: One day the wind up with big, soaring in the nine miles.
sentences.chinese: 大鹏一日同风起，扶摇直上九万里。

sentences.english: The cost of living has skyrocketed. Income levels have plummeted.
sentences.chinese: 生活费扶摇直上，而收入则一泻千里。

sentences.english: But it’s also forging ahead in everything from auto manufacturing to software production.
sentences.chinese: 但也在从汽车制造业到软件业等诸多行业扶摇直上。

sentences.english: But the amount of merchandising that Ducati is about to sell is going to be stratospheric.
sentences.chinese: 但现在杜卡迪的存货销售应该是扶摇直上三千尺。

sentences.english: From the perspective of the trend in the near future, sales soared.
sentences.chinese: 从近期走势看，销售量扶摇直上。

definition: to soar into the sky
to soar/to rocket
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
to rise rapidly/to shoot up
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to ascend slowly
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
to increase sharply/to rise dramatically
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
filling the atmosphere/covering the sky
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
